snippet: Aliy Zirkle, who was second the last two years, left the Yukon River village of Kaltag, Alaska, at 3:18 a.m. Saturday to retake the lead from Martin Buser.
abstract: Aliy Zirkle is the first musher to reach the west coast of Alaska in the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race, retaking lead from former champion Martin Buser.
lead_paragraph: Aliy Zirkle, who was second the last two years, left the Yukon River village of Kaltag, Alaska, at 3:18 a.m. Saturday to retake the lead from Martin Buser.
